item.title: How to be a better programmer - the redux
item.description: “Software development productivity would skyrocket if the least effective 30% were fired tomorrow” – Neal Ford It was in the December of 2005 that I first wrote about how to be a better programmer. At that time I was into my fifth year as a programmer, and though I wanted to write what I am writing today, I decided to narrow down my scope to non-technical issues. I wrote about code readability and code maintainability that day.
